articles.headline: Efforts to Avert Sectarian Reprisals After Shrine Attack
articles.snippet: Appeals for calm appeared to have headed off the risk of a new sectarian convulsion, at least for now.
articles.abstract: Appeals for calm appeared to have headed off the risk of a new sectarian convulsion, at least for now.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, June 13 — Two explosions on Wednesday that appeared to have been set by Sunni extremists with links to Al Qaeda toppled the twin golden minarets that were most of what remained of one of Iraq’s most revered Shiite shrines after a devastating bombing by Al Qaeda last year.

articles.headline: 4 in Senate Seek Penalty for China
articles.snippet: Four leading Democratic and Republican senators proposed legislation aimed at penalizing China over its export practices.
articles.abstract: Four leading Democratic and Republican senators proposed legislation aimed at penalizing China over its export practices.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 13 — Four leading Democratic and Republican senators proposed legislation Wednesday aimed at penalizing China over its export practices and predicted that they would have the votes to pass it in Congress this year even if it was vetoed by President Bush.

articles.headline: Barneys Could Be Sold to Dubai Firm
articles.snippet: The Jones Apparel Group is near an agreement to sell Barneys New York for about $825 million to the investment arm of the Dubai government.
articles.abstract: The Jones Apparel Group is near an agreement to sell Barneys New York for about $825 million to the investment arm of the Dubai government.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Jones Apparel Group is close to an agreement to sell Barneys New York, the fashionable clothing retailer, for about $825 million to the investment arm of the Dubai government, people involved in the talks said yesterday.
articles.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael Barbaro

articles.headline: An Obama Patron and Friend Until an Indictment
articles.snippet: As Barack Obama runs for president, a once-beneficial relationship with an entrepreneur becomes problematic.
articles.abstract: As Barack Obama runs for president, a once-beneficial relationship with an entrepreneur becomes problematic.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Antoin Rezko, an entrepreneur of considerable charm who found riches in fast food and real estate, is known around Chicago as a collector of politicians.
articles.byline: By Christopher Drew and Mike McIntire

articles.headline: Headphones to Shut Out the World
articles.snippet: A test of 10 pairs of noise-canceling headphones reveals some unexpected stars.
articles.abstract: A test of 10 pairs of noise-canceling headphones reveals some unexpected stars.
articles.lead_paragraph: As you may have heard, air travel this summer isn’t going to be pretty.

articles.headline: In Health Care, Cost Isn’t Proof of High Quality
articles.snippet: A new study presents stark evidence that high medical payments do not buy high-quality patient care.
articles.abstract: A new study presents stark evidence that high medical payments do not buy high-quality patient care.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stark evidence that high medical payments do not necessarily buy high-quality patient care is presented in a hospital study set for release today.

articles.headline: Kellogg to Phase Out Some Food Ads to Children
articles.snippet: The company will phase out ads aimed at children under 12 unless the products meet nutrition guidelines.
articles.abstract: The company will phase out ads aimed at children under 12 unless the products meet nutrition guidelines.
articles.lead_paragraph: Froot Loops’ days on Saturday morning television may be numbered.

articles.headline: Hamas Seizes Broad Control in Gaza Strip
articles.snippet: The Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas, faces the collapse of Fatah power in Gaza and a putative Palestinian state divided between Fatah and Hamas.
articles.abstract: The Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas, faces the collapse of Fatah power in Gaza and a putative Palestinian state divided between Fatah and Hamas.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM, June 13 — Hamas forces consolidated control over much of Gaza on Wednesday, taking command of the main north-south road and blowing up a Fatah headquarters in Khan Yunis, in the south.

articles.headline: Fighting the Web, Sports Teams Seek to Control Ticket Resales
articles.snippet: Teams are controlling the resale market for their tickets to cut down on counterfeiting and the high prices demanded by scalpers.
articles.abstract: Teams are controlling the resale market for their tickets to cut down on counterfeiting and the high prices demanded by scalpers.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the N.B.A. finals resume today in Cleveland, Dan Gilbert, the owner of the Cavaliers, will be showing off the youngest, flashiest asset in his portfolio.
